definitions.definition: not anything; no single thing

examples.text: There was nothing in her bag.
There's nothing you can do to help.
The doctor said there was nothing wrong with me.
**Nothing else** matters to him apart from his job.
It cost us nothing to go in.
He's five foot nothing *(= exactly five feet tall)*.

definitions.definition: very little; something that is not at all important or interesting

examples.text: We did nothing at the weekend.
‘What's that in your pocket?’ ‘Oh, nothing.’
I know **next to nothing** *(= almost nothing)* about art.

definitions.definition: to be a person that somebody has no feelings for

examples.text: I used to love her but she's nothing to me any more.

definitions.definition: to have no connection with somebody/something

examples.text: Get out! It's nothing to do with you *(= you have no right to know about it)*.
That has nothing to do with what we're discussing.

definitions.definition: without payment

examples.text: She's always trying to get **something for nothing**.

definitions.definition: with no reward or result

examples.text: All that preparation was for nothing because the visit was cancelled.

definitions.definition: to have much less of a particular quality than somebody/something

examples.text: I'm quite a fast worker, but I've got nothing on her!

definitions.definition: to have no information that could show somebody to be guilty of something
used as a polite way of replying when somebody thanks you for doing something, to show that you were happy to do it

examples.text: ‘Thanks for all your help.’ ‘It was nothing—I enjoyed it.’

definitions.definition: for a very good reason

examples.text: Not for nothing was he called the king of rock and roll.

definitions.definition: only; no more/less than

examples.text: Nothing but a miracle can save her now.
I want nothing but the best for my children.

definitions.definition: extremely; very

examples.text: The trip was nothing if not varied.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize how great or extreme something is

examples.text: It was nothing less than a disaster.

definitions.definition: not at all like

examples.text: It looks nothing like a horse.

definitions.definition: not nearly; not at all

examples.text: I had nothing like enough time to answer all the questions.

definitions.definition: not a great amount of something; nothing of great value or importance

examples.text: There's nothing much in the fridge.
I got up late and did nothing much all day.

definitions.definition: (it’s) very easy

examples.text: You'll soon learn. There's nothing to it really.

definitions.definition: to be willing to do anything to get what you want, even if it is dishonest or wrong

examples.text: She’ll stop at nothing to make money.

definitions.definition: romantic words

examples.text: to whisper sweet nothings in somebody’s ear

definitions.definition: there is no other action to take except the one mentioned

examples.text: There was nothing else for it but to resign.

definitions.definition: something is/was not true

examples.text: There was a rumour she was going to resign, but there was nothing in it.

definitions.definition: used to say that you enjoy something very much

examples.text: There's nothing like a brisk walk on a cold day!

wordOrigin: Old English nān thing (see no, thing).
